ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned advanced French Skills and also learned more about French culture. I also learned how to properly evaluate French texts. I felt like this course allowed me to improve my speaking to be more fluid.

fluency in the French language
contextual immersion with the French language and culture, especially historically (in terms of the Second World War and how colonization affected different groups
honed research skills in French as we prepared for our individual presentations
better speaking skills and improving gaps in grammar
intermediate french level grammar, information about french culture, other french-speaking countries, france during WW2
I deepened my understanding of French language and the national diversity in French literature.
I improved my French knowledge and skill.
I got better at French.
I developed my French reading and comprehension skills.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I like the small classroom environment of this course. I feel as though the teacher really wanted everyone to be engaged. The course materials are very helpful and I feel as though the homework strengthened my learning.

a lot of homework was done every day, and sometimes they weren't checked.

loved the intimate nature of the class and how we discussed our readings; we might have brushed through some topics on the course packet which became overwhelming nearing assessment times.

strengths: readings tend to be interesting, more of a chance to discuss readings and films
weaknesses: workload is super intense, gets unmanageable when you start reading "Un sac de billes", class environment was a bit tense sometimes

this class was very intensive - lots of daily work that you had to do in order to keep up with the class. the book passages are also quite long and you need to know them in detail to participate fully in class. but manageable as long as you don't fall behind with things

This class reviewed a lot of grammar that we learned in previous French courses, which was helpful reinforcement. However, I felt that there could have been greater engagement with the grammar in class beyond simply checking answers to homework. I think that more interactive activities regarding grammar that encourage participation would have been great. Also, the feedback on past assignments, especially exams and essays, wasn't always prompt enough to apply commentary to later assignments.
A lot of daily work
I think it could have been more focused on listening and speaking rather than grammar and reading.
I really enjoyed the variety of material we read and watched for this course. It offered a diverse perspective of the Francophone world.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would recommend this course to another student to improve their French speaking skills!
yes
It does help your French skills, but, oh boy, there is so much work, especially at the end of the year. So, you really have to love French and be willing to put in the work to get the most of it!
if you like french or if you need to satisfy a language requirement! I did also enjoy the material.
Yes, I think that this course is a fine course in advanced French and introduction to French literature.
Yes
No, take an easier language
I would recommend this course because it offered a diverse education about the Francophone world and provided different learning media that are suitable for a range of learners.
